author: fatmanuronarir
title: Instant Financial Data Application
description:
There are 2 main issues we can try to solve.

Gold, dollar, euro investors are not willing to invest in Cardan
Investors cannot calculate their instant profits and losses correctly or easily.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal presents a novel approach to improving the knowledge of Cardano among those who  invest heavily in gold , dollar and Euro. This would increase the number of people who are involved in the Cardano ecosystem. This tool would serve as a helper investment app that provides useful information about the state of a user’s investments. This could help to track cost basis for investment info. Then alongside that information, there would be articles about Cardano. I enjoy the utility of an app that those outside of our ecosystem can find useful and then see regular updates about ADA. This is an impactful project.
f6_assessments.q1:
This proposal appears to be highly not feasible primarily due to the lack of specificity in the timeline, budget, and team members skills/experience. 

The problem with this proposal is that it lacks sufficient detail to determine whether the project will be feasible given the budget and time frame. For example, the timeline says that it will take two months to “determine the financial calculations to be used in the app.” What exactly are the sorts of calculations to be considered? What process will be taken to develop these calculations? How will their utility be determined? Would there be a process for surveying potential users and understanding their use cases? Perhaps a little market research could have been done prior to seeking funding and added to this proposal? As an example, say you do a survey on the cardano community discord asking what kind of data potential users would like in their app. Then put the results into the proposal. 

The similar thing with marketing. The proposal recognizes that marketing will be key. But, it is necessary to market to an audience. Next time, consider researching potential sites where gold, dollar, and euro buyers are active, perhaps on Reddit. Do a poll to see if this app would meet a need, and then publicize your progress to a community that is already interested in seeing this come about. There are additional ways that this proposal could have been added to. I would recommend seeking out the proposals that are funded during this round after voting concludes to research what makes a proposal likely to be assessed at a higher score.  

In order to assess a proposal as completely feasible, assessors need to have enough details to make sure that 1. The proposer has thought through the full cost of the project, (don’t build a tower until you have accounted for all the materials, costs, and labor needed). 2. The prosper and their team are capable of succeeding in the project in the timeframe and with the budet. This is to protect both Project Catalyst and the proposer from the risks of failing. Project Catalyst loses the funds, and the proposer loses reputation. 

All this to say, I am not saying the proposer is incapable of completing this project. In fact, it is highly likely they are. But, the reason for the score of 1 is that the proposal itself does not present enough evidence to show this assessor that this is a feasible project by the team on the budget and in the timeframe described. Best of luck next time.
f6_assessments.q2:
This project is not clear or feasible due to the lack of appropriate detail provided. 

One of the purposes of the first two auditability questions is to provide enough detail to the assessors and voters to show that the plan will be transparent in communicating progress with catalysts. The first step is to have a clear set of measurable metrics. For example, how does the timeframe align with the goals of the project, and what tasks will be completed when. Then the auditability can say, the project will measure completion of goals and publish them in a monthly report to catalyst, or upload them to github, or a public website. As an assessor, I want to see evidence that the team will take the investment of catalyst funds seriously by committing themselves to a series of goals that can be easily measured within and without your team. Again, I recommend the team review the winning proposals from Fund 9 for examples of auditability. Again, the low score is a result of the lack of detail in this proposal, not a statement about the capacity of the team in any way at all. Blessings.
f6_assessments.reply: thank you so much for your time and great advice!!

f6_assessments.q0:
I believe the proposal either misinterpreted the challenge brief or accidentally posted their proposal to the wrong challenge. 

The proposal is wanting to provide a service for traders and investors, I don't see how this is a provide legal & financial services solution for funded projects. 

The proposal does not explicitly "describe how their proposed solution will address the Challenge." 

Perhaps this should have been posted to the "Dapps, Products & Integrations" challenge?
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal has some details about some milestones and timeline. Would have love to see more breakdown about each of the milestone. What does "The application will be written by the programmer" entail? 

The proposal has a detailed budget breakdown with line item details about different part of the work. 

The is summary about the team, would have love to see some verifiable references of the team (linkedin profile, past software contributions, or something along those lines)
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal plans to measure how many people download the app and read the articles. There is however no details about how they plan to manage the work internally or how the community can follow with the development. 

The proposal's definition of success does not link back to the challenge's definition of success. Without explicitly tying your definition of success back to the challenge's, the community has no way of knowing if "introducing cardano to gold, dollar and euro investors" is what we ask for in this particular challenge.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you so much for your time. Even if my proposal didn't seem directly related to this challenge, it did seem relevant as it would be a financial calculator on a legal level. But you are right, Dapps, Products & Integrations would also be better. Still, i believe 1 point is low.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal would be within the challenge goal,  and I think that this proposal probably will increase utility & adoption of crypto values in general but not aligned with the challenge. At the same time the statement of how problem is to be solved is poorly explained and in my opinion it doesn’t clear how users receive benefits with download of this app and it doesn’t clear how this proposal can create financial incentive for community.
I think it's important to improve details about the proposal services solution for the challenge (eg. Typical services use case for developer, example benefit for service creator and community, …)
f6_assessments.q1:
There aren’t link/informations in the proposal that refers to professional skills of the proposer, so it is not possible to identify the teams the work on the proposal and the proposal assessment is difficult (“I took finance classes and i am very well educated in math”).
The scope of the solution is poorly explained (e.g. how the funds will be spent, what features will be implemented, and so on…). There is a too simple cost worksheet, that doesn’t contain all costs (eg. Infrastructure, cloud license, etc.)
The plan for implementation could have been a bit more specific.
f6_assessments.q2: The given metrics measure what the proposer wants to do. As mentioned above, the description of the solution is poorly explained (e.g. how the funds will be spent, how the solution improve their customer experience, and so on…), so the progress of this proposal is not simple to assess.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you so much for your time

f6_assessments.q0: The proposers aim to develop a financial application with a niche towards gold, dollar and euro investors. The business model seems to on-board these investors and then introduce them to Cardano and Bitcoin as financial options. This is in line with the challenge setting “Legal & Financial Implementations”. It could be argued that this solution also could be entered in the “DApp” challenge but since this application is niched specifically towards the financial sector, it seems like a good fit in its current category. As a result, its impact is indeed great, and a score of 5 points will be awarded.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposing team is very well experienced and suited for the project they’re proposing. In order to increase the credibility of these claims, it would be favorable if LinkedIn profiles or something alike is provided in order to back up said claims. 
The detailed plan is sparse and split up into 3 months increments, it does not go into detail of what has to be done at each stage. It provides more of an oversight of the project. This could be improved with more concrete tasks that describe who will do what in each monthly increment. It should also state how much time you plan to dedicate in each phase.
The budget is also simple in its nature but it showcases fair hourly rates that justifies the claimed budget. The above mentioned shortcomings will deduct 2 points from the total score in terms of feasibility. You are encouraged to look at other successful proposals in previous funds to gain inspiration of how a detailed plan, roadmap and time estimates could be structured. Score: neutral, 3 points.
f6_assessments.q2:
In terms of auditability it is stated in the proposal that “We can easily measure how many people have downloaded the application” and “We can measure how many of those who enter Cardano data and how many read Cardano articles.” to track the project's progress. However, these are metrics better suited to evaluate the success of the project. A suggestion is to introduce milestones and KPIs that allow the community to audit the progress *during* development. 
The definition of success is stated as “We hope to introduce cardano to gold, dollar and euro investors who do not want to invest in coins.”, this is a soft goal with no real measurable metrics. Another suggestion is to introduce hard goals to properly evaluate the projects success against this criteria. Ie. 100 investors after x amount of time, 1000k invested after y amount of time etc.
Lastly, a public channel, blog or website should be provided so that the community can audit the project from your progress updates. 
There is some work to be done in terms of auditability, but the fundamentals are in the right place. A neutral score will be given, 3 points.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you so much for your time and advice

As there is no infra yet that provides immediate details on profits and losses more accurately and instantly with time and data. As They have built a app which will calculate on real time bases which will be helpful for investors who Trade in Gold, Euro and Dollar instantly. As they plan to add Cardano to existing app which will be helpful to get more investors ands users which surely will be helpful for community. Adding article will add more users to Cardano and many will get to know. This proposal effectively addresses the challenge and I strongly agree with proposal .
f6_assessments.q1: The roadmap looks sensible and they have explained in detail, They have divided in phases such as financial calculations stage and developing website stage and time limit also looks great and not wasting any time. The amount requested is not much as other projects and he has provided were and how funds will be used so integrating something big cardano to app will give a shoutout for community. Both proposer and his teammate looks experienced and both themselves can handle the project. As the project is less risk and can be completed soon., I feel with given experience and plan presented it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully and I agree with proposer
f6_assessments.q2:
As KPIs will be already available in public domain. As number of people downloaded   applications and number people read article about Cardano and who all entered newly after knowing about it.
As introducing Cardano to gold , Dollar , Euro can directly invest in APP, As its new for Cardano it will surely add weightage to community and ecosystem .I strongly agree with proposer .As we get KPIs from that we can assess the progress of proposal.

I strongly agree with proposal.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you so much for your opinion and support!

f6_assessments.q0:
"The proposal was developed to not only solve the investor’s challenges smartly by supporting them in calculation but also introducing Cardano as well. The proposer already explained clearly about how the product benefits users. Another strong point of this proposal is the big potential to increase the number of people joining in Cardano. On the other hand, they can add some more case-studies to ensure that the logic of proposal is feasible. 
The main indicator of this proposal will be the number of users who download the application, see Cardano data and news. However, proposer has not mentioned about the expected number of users yet, so, it is suggested to include these numbers in the proposal. 
The biggest challenge of this proposal is how much people know about the application. Therefore, the proposer finds it be the most important points to consider and overcome. "
f6_assessments.q1:
"The timeline is prepared in such the simplest way that shows the overconfident of the proposer team. However, it might cause the ambiguous when implementation. Therefore, it is suggested that the proposer team will re-write the timeline, with include both what they want to do and how they want to implement, with tentative timing. 
The budget is prepared shortly by the proposer as the total fund is not really big. However, with the general number, it reduces the level of accountability of the proposal team to donor. So, please consider making it clear, by more broken down the items that they want to pay.
Team includes only two people in which one person will cover the financial part and one person for technical matter. As the first step is quite simple, these two people might be capable to implement this proposal. 
"
f6_assessments.q2:
"In this part, the proposer needs to clarify the quantitative data to monitor the progress of project implementation, as well as its development.  Still the explanation of proposer is too simple to show the seriousness of the proposer. So, it is suggested the proposer to re-write this part to let all readers feel the effort of proposer to realize the proposal. 
The proser shared shortly about their intentions that the Cardano will be introduced to those who don’t want to invest to coin. However, it is not clear enough for final confirmation that the project could complete. The proposer can consider again on making the success be more clear. 
The project is the new one in Catalyst in this round. 
"
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you so much for your time and opinion!

f6_assessments.q0:
This is an excellent idea where it can boost gold, dollar and euros users to invest in cardano. Many a times people find difficulty in converting currencies and converting the currencies into cardano, this proposed solution can definitely help them, where it can help end users to calculate and pre-meditate on what time to invest on cardano.
The proposed plan can even help in calculating the future developments and finding best time to sell the coins so that it can make the user earn the maximum profit from it. hence this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal doesn't require massive development team or optimized coding team to achieve this , with just ordinary app developer the task can be achieved where it needs to multiply or divide with input value with current market value of each currencies, where all the mentioned aspects are already available in programming libraries.
The biggest challenge here is how does the user makes end user to use his app, because normal convertors are already available in the google currently and spending 16000 dollars to build such an app will be of no much use, hence with minimal risk involved iven experience and plan presented it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The audit doesn't mention about marketing th e App , where data related to marketing is not seen even in budget breaking or timeline of the project, With no marketing strategy involved, how will the end user get to know the app is there, hence he'll tend to use the convertors which are available online.
Other than marketing strategy the plan presented decent budget breaking and timeline of the project. The audit has clear and easy idea on how to calculate the success rate of the project where it just needs to calculate the number of entries or reviews given by the audience, hence information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.
f6_assessments.reply: thank you for your time and great opinions!

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is very unique, in regards to financial calculations application. It's about creating app allows gold, dollar, euro traders, from what I understand, this app for this purpose, the investor will be able to see also Cardano option and articles. It would be something totally new, to introduce blockchain in the software application universe, and it is a great idea to do this with Cardano, I believe it will be able to attract a new type of audience, increasing transactions on our blockchain and publicizing it, thus achieving the specific objectives of this challenge. It would also be quite beneficial for investors, as they will have their information minted into smart and detail information. Perhaps the good use of this apps also favours the interest of this new niche in the cryptographic world, who knows if they go beyond the use of connected investor and are interested in knowing more about blockchain and even about our ecosystem. 

One observation I would like to make, however, is about a part of the proposal. The proposers state that if funded, "They will also be able to find articles about Cardano. In this way, we will meet and introduce gold, dollar, and euro investors with Cardano...and they will introduce Cardano to investors who are not interested in coins.”. For the articles concept, it should be better if this concept to be explained, this would produce a more complete understanding of the proposal as a whole by the CAs, voters and all those who read this project. 

It is very positive how the proposers set challenges to be met here; demonstrates that they have enough experience to recognize the adversities of the area in which they decide to work, whether for example the lack of professional evidence of the investors who are not willing to make investments like Cardano or the short time on the market. With that, they already outline solutions, showing a lot of preparation and planning, which will certainly increase the chances of success of the proposal and the impact will be positive and adequate with what the present challenge seeks. 

However, the proposer should provide details of the targeted people who will visit the website and use the application, so the proposer have clear picture of risks that could prevent them from delivering the project successfully and the proposer should also explain how they will mitigate the risk
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer explain which tasks would be developed in order to build their final product, and divide them through several phases. Each of these phases has a list of tasks, so that it is quite clear what would happen and in what sequence. What I missed, however, was a temporal notion, that is, understanding how long each of these phases and tasks would take to start and be completed, also in which month of the year they are scheduled to happen and etc (we know that the phase to be funded would take three months, but when would it start)? 

 There is a highly detailed script and explained in a technical way but possible to understand; the only question would be to place ourselves better in time and space, but the level of detail should be explained better for:
-  "Determining the financial calculations to be used in app". The proposers should provide evidence of the relevant skill and experience in determining the financial calculation to be used.
- "The application will be written by the programmer" The proposer should provide details of the user acceptance test, on when will be the application Live in Production 
the proposer should provide not only what was being done but also how to do it, so as it conveys a lot of confidence in the process and accurate financial calculation result.

Regarding the budget requested, I believe that the value is quite fair for the complexity of the work to be performed. It is basically the salary of the professionals involved, as the proposers explain, the salaries added together give approximately 16K, and in the period of 3 months this would be an average of 5k (which is requested in the financing). This part of the proposal is very clear and I don't think there is any observation to be made. 

About the team involved, it would be better if the proposer can provide details of the team, team is made up of which employees; to tell their main functions, a small work history and links such as LinkedIn (in addition to their achievement and personal contacts), through which we can verify the information that is described. It is conveyed total confidence in the team, because in addition to a great degree of detail about who they are, we also know the role that each one would play in the project. 

and finally, the proposer is expected to explain if they are funded, more detail on why they will not return to Catalyst in a later round for further funding.

and finally, the proposer is expected to explain if they are funded, more detail on why they will not return to Catalyst in a later round for further funding.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer needs to establish more detail of what would be the key success and acceptance of the project, so that we can clearly analyse the results. Proposer only mention that they can measure how many of those who enter Cardano data and how many read Cardano articles. They should put numbers of the targeted people, from how many populations that available in the market versus how many people are visiting the website and how many willing to access the application and how many become interested in coins. 

The measurement of KPI, it is also should be possible to audit the progress/development of the project, through the highly detailed task listing present in the previous topic. So, it will be positive when the team is concerned with building ways to audit the project and not just providing information for that, because it's one thing for us (the Cardano community) to go after updates, results and feedback, and another for the team to come up with strategies. of analysis and make them accessible to everyone. So, this proposal is very good, I would like to congratulate this team for writing the proposal, and come up with this great idea.
It is accessible, and at the same it should be auditable. The proposal expected to provides more detail of possible to monitor through the strategies devised by the team and also through the direct monitoring of the tasks to be performed.
f6_assessments.reply: thank you so much for your time and great opinions

f6_assessments.q0: The challenge asks how gold, dollar euro (fiat currency) and bitcoin and Cardano (Crypto currency) can use for financial transaction and able to measure profit and losses instantly after the users conduct the transaction. This proposal aims to do that by creating the application or App that makes both fiat currency and Crypto currency could use for financial transaction, Thus, calculate profit and losses at the same time. I thought, it is a good idea to make the App to advertise the Cardano. Although, it is a good Idea but it does not set various specific solution for the challenge. Provide legal financial App is insufficient to market the Cardano to investor, perhaps conduct mini workshop or provide booth in the event and/or in the Mall should be added to introduce and market the Cardano to the investor (it depends on the budget). Meanwhile, the risk should take into account in having Financial App such as cyber security risk. Because I do not see what risk would occur while people use the App and how it mitigates it. Although the proposal does not set various specific solution for the challenge, I consider the proposal address the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The team is comprised of one technical founder who understand financial calculation and one software developer to undertake the application and site creation and advertising. Although, it is sufficient to make the App, but insufficient to market the Cardano. the team may wish to consider how best to ensure the project executes on a robust marketing strategy if the intention is mass adoption. It needs additional description how to market the App to the investor. In addition, the team need to consider to return to the Catalyst for further funding for marketing purpose and the development App program. I think this cannot do in one time project only, otherwise it wastes it. furthermore, the project should have the matric or KPI to define success of the proposal. given the project plan looks like “trial and error” project, I cannot agree on this.
f6_assessments.q2: The team measure success of the project base on how many people download the App, enter to Cardano data and read Cardano articles. This is alright but, the team need to consider regularity of using ADA cardano to their financial transaction compare to fiat currency. Thus, it can use to measure success of the project. given the information the team provided does not sufficient to audit the progress and success of the proposal. therefore, I neither agree nor disagree on this.
f6_assessments.reply: thank you so much for your time and great opinions

f6_assessments.q0:
I want to begin with their problem statement I quote “ There are 2 main issues we can try to solve. 
1. Gold, dollar, euro investors are not willing to invest in Cardano.
2. Investors cannot calculate their instant profits and losses correctly or easily “. 
The first statement is true and fits in with the challenge because the preaching and spreading of the word Cardano is not well established within the heart and mind of the investors. In their problem solution summary they stated also that the investors who will download the app will see or come across Cardano option and an article which makes sense to me, and its a positive move towards the catalyst ecosystem. The KPIs they indicated seems to fall in line and the proposal also seems to address the future challenge as well. Also they made I tangible statements in their proposal which is address the challenge I quote “ Our Fianancal app will be completely legal as it will only contain financial calculations and articles about Cardano and not give investment advice. With this legal financial application, we will introduce Cardano to investors who are not interested in coins “ so it clearly tells that Cardano/catalyst ecosystem is part of the keys factor in their proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: With their feasibility the proposal did gave an account of experience and skill sets to accomplish the project. The team is made up of two members a physicist and a software developer, but in my view I would be happy if there was a member who has a financial background. From the look of thing the proposal seems to target investors whom are in trading of Gold, Dollar, Euro and Cardano all of these are money and someone with financial background will help a lot. They did provide a detailed implementable plain with a timeline attached to it and it is a good plan if well implemented. Also I didn’t see any additional funding estimate in their proposal so I think it a one time thing. Looking at their budget I think it’s reasonable for them to complete the project and their budget was well breakdown and it is easily understandable. The technical aspect of this proposal which makes it looks good is the creation of website which cardano/catalyst ecosystem will be well preached and elucidated more further over there. Lastly given credit to them not being on any other project will help them focus solely on this project than giving them divided attention.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal was provided with roadmap with milestones and time for the achievement of the project. The KPI that they provided in the proposal makes sense and it is achievable if they stake to it. They didn’t state anywhere in the proposal how the community can track their progress on the project. I was looking forward to see a structure which tell us about reporting to the community in time how the progress has been made so far. And they made it look like after the funding the have anything to do with the community if I may say.
f6_assessments.reply: thank you so much for your time and great opinions

f6_assessments.q0:
The project was created to help the gold, dollar, and euro traders calculate profits and losses instantly. When investors purchase gold dollars or euros at different periods, it is difficult to calculate their earnings and losses in real-time. This application will calculate a financial income statement. Investors will be able to transfer their gold, dollars, euros, bitcoin, and Cardano holdings. They can specify the price and quantity. With the financial algorithms, they will be able to know instantly how much and at what rate of profit and loss they have made each of them. The initial goal is to encourage more gold, dollar, and euro investors to utilize this application for computations. They will also be able to find Cardano-related articles. In this approach, the application will help and introduce Cardano to gold, dollar, and euro investors. This is align with the challenge.
I noticed that the proposer had an idea, but the proposer didn't have in-depth technical explanations. For example, what algorithm will the application be built on, and what programming language and technical elements are added to increase the professional credibility of the project. Proposer identifies it as a completely legitimate app as it only provides financial calculations and Cardano articles and does not provide investment advice.
In the risk description, the proposer only raised a single challenge in terms of communication and application advertising. However, the proposer did not provide a specific plan to address this difficulty. In my personal opinion, there are still some other difficulties that the proposer should be aware of, for example, the audit of the application, the latency of the data compared to real-time, or the related errors to the user.
f6_assessments.q1:
The project was planned to be implemented in 3 months, the proposer provided the work to be done, but it was not clear. I suggest that the proposer should have a roadmap as detailed as possible, which shows the contents, for example, the specific date/month to start the project; detailed workload in each month/week/day... a more detailed description of key milestones content will help to manage and evaluate work effectively, on time. In addition, each content needs additional people to perform, or who will be responsible for evaluating the work when it is completed.
The budget allocation is described quite clearly. I can understand that the proposer will spend that money to pay for what activities, for how many hours, to pay for someone... that is very necessary. However, in the category of writing articles and advertising activities, the proposer should still add detailed activities, as it is not explicitly mentioned in the budget allocation.
The personnel description is not complete, I did not find any information about the person who will carry out the project: full name, education level, and work experience are not provided. The only information can relevant to the project is that Proposer's physics department is among the top 50 physics departments in the world according to US News & World Report. However, the proposer also did not provide the name and related information. This is difficult to assess the team because the data provided is incomplete. I suggest that the proposer should add this content to increase the credibility of the project.
f6_assessments.q2:
It seems to me that the proposer has been underinvested in this Auditability content. The proof is that the expected contents and figures are not specifically listed. Proposer only says it will measure how many users download the app, or how many people have read articles about Cardano, but does not provide specific expectations, nor does it have a timeline for accomplishing those things.
I suggest that the proposer can add the suggested contents as above, and at the same time can use software from third parties such as Jira, and Ora software to monitor and manage the project's progress.
f6_assessments.reply: thank you so much for your time and great opinions

solution: Our app allows gold, dollar, euro traders to calculate their profits & losses instantly. When they download this app for this purpose, they will be able to see also Cardano option and articles in app.
experience:
My team has a physicist (me) and a software developer. My physics department is among the top 50 physics departments in the world according to US News & World Report. So I'm very good at calculations.
Our software developer has experience in making and presenting applications.
